com.javax0.jdsl.log

Class LogReporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.javax0.jdsl.log.LogReporter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Reporter

    public class LogReporter
extends Object
implements Reporter
    Some simple logging helper methods that help to generate logs for the debugging of the grammars.

    When using this library the logs are important to understand what is happening during the syntax analysis process when there is some error in the grammar definition. Therefore the logs generated in the library are not only important to analyze and debug the library itself but rather the program that uses the library. Although this is the case more or less in case of most of the libraries in this case this is even more important. That is because grammars are not simple things.

    Author:
    Peter Verhas

    • Method Detail

      • setMaxDebugChars

        public static void setMaxDebugChars(int maxDebugChars)
        Set the maximum number of characters of the input displayed when logging an analyzer start. By default this value is 16.

        Log messages display this many characters of the input, and in case there are more than maxDebugChars in the input then elipsis ... is appended on the display.

        public String toString(List<Analyzer> analyzerList,
              String sepChar)
        Convert a list of analyzers into string representation proper for logging/debugging purposes.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Reporter
        Parameters:
        analyzerList - the list of the analyzers
        sepChar - is the separator character, , when this is a list and | when the list is used by an alternatives analyzer.
